Follow up on the last one:

Fuck Twitter

Like nuclear fission, social media has gotten away from us and now we scramble to recover our society from the brink of calamity.

It‚Äôs impossible to comprehend the variety of human experiences I need to interpret while scanning Twitter. Yet, Twitter is far from a magnifying lens. It‚Äôs more like a kaleidoscope or a fun mirror. It‚Äôs showing what humans pretend to be when we perform for each other.

I always knew that Twitter wasn‚Äôt reality but I rarely considered how much of it was an orchestrated fabrication.

Reply All ‚Äì Is Facebook Spying on You?

How to Avoid Being Tracked by Facebook

The open web needs a friend

There is no organization repping the interest of the open web.

The big tech companies behave like big companies. Right now there is nothing that balances that power. The journalists and academics have been in awe of them, and have been reluctant to understand the issues. I don‚Äôt expect much from that combination until they get serious about protecting the resource that we all need.

Newsgeist

It would be interesting to have the same conference without the journalists. Also they could use some more independent software devs. They look to Facebook and Google for everything. Independent devs are much more likely to give them what they want.

I should have proposed a session about how Facebook and Google are actively destroying the open web. Maybe we can get some of the reporters to look at that? Right now they mostly still want Facebook to give them money. That sickens me because Facebook is not what I think of as a good news system.
